abstract: Treasury Secretary Timothy F. Geithner on Friday criticized the huge bonuses that Wall Street is expected to pay this year and he rejected the contention by Goldman Sachs that it would have survived the financial crisis without $10 billion in government bailout money.
snippet: Treasury Secretary Timothy F. Geithner on Friday criticized the huge bonuses that Wall Street is expected to pay this year and he rejected the contention by Goldman Sachs that it would have survived the financial crisis without $10 billion in gove...
lead_paragraph: Treasury Secretary Timothy F. Geithner on Friday criticized the huge bonuses that Wall Street was expected to pay this year and he rejected the contention by Goldman Sachs that it would have survived the financial crisis without $10 billion in government bailout money.

headline.main: Geithner Assails Huge Wall Street Bonuses
